ranked_diseases.disease_name: Congenital adrenal hyperplasia due to 21-hydroxylase deficiency
ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic presentation with clitoral hypertrophy and hyperpigmentation. All three reference cases with identical phenotypes were diagnosed with this condition. The hyperpigmentation results from elevated ACTH stimulating melanocytes.

ranked_diseases.disease_name: Congenital adrenal hyperplasia due to 11-beta-hydroxylase deficiency
ranked_diseases.explanation: Also presents with virilization (clitoral hypertrophy) and can have hyperpigmentation due to elevated ACTH, but less common than 21-hydroxylase deficiency.

ranked_diseases.disease_name: Congenital adrenal hyperplasia due to 3-beta-hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase deficiency
ranked_diseases.explanation: Can cause mild virilization in females and hyperpigmentation from ACTH elevation, but typically less severe virilization than other CAH forms.
Causes virilization in females including clitoral hypertrophy due to inability to convert androgens to estrogens, but hyperpigmentation is not a typical feature.
Can present with café-au-lait spots (hyperpigmentation) and precocious puberty which might include clitoral enlargement, but the pattern differs from CAH.
